Snare: A Snared creature can't move on its turn (it can use actions).
Stun: A Stunned creature must skip its turn.
Sleep:
A Sleeping creature must skip its turn.
If the Sleeping creature takes damage, it wakes up (if it took the damage before its turn).
The Sleeping creature might also wake up from unusually loud noises.
Dazed:
A Dazed Unit is Slowed and only has a Half-Action on its turn if it's a Player Character. It can't make Opportunity Attacks while Dazed.
A Dazed NPC makes one less attack per turn.
Charm:
A Charmed Unit is Dazed and must use all its movement to move towards the Charmer.
It can't target the Charmer with offensive Abilities.
Feared:
A Feared Unit is Slowed and must use all movement to move away from the source at any point during its turn.
All Attacks done have Cover while its fear source is in sight.
Paralyze:
A Paralyzed creature must skip its turn.
It makes a Might Check at the end of its every turn.
If it succeeds, it breaks the Paralysis.
Poisoned:
A Poisoned creature doesn't heal on Long Rests, and taked 1d4 damage instead.
Poisoned lasts until cured.
Blind:
When the Blinded attacks, the target benefits from Hard Cover (+4 Defense).
Enemies of the Blinded have +4 on rolling Checks against it.
Slow: A Slowed creature loses half (rounded down) of its movement speed. E.g. if a Unit with 5 Speed is Slowed, its Speed becomes 3.
Silence:
A Silenced creature can't cast spells (but it can use non-spells and weapons).
Passive abilities function normally when silenced.
Cripple: A Crippled Unit can't attack with weapons or use physical offensive Abilities.
Maimed: A Maimed Unit can't use Actions, but can only use Half-Actions, one at a time.
Prone:
It has -2 to all attacks and Checks while Prone.
Can't make Opportunity Attacks while Prone.
The Prone creature must use half of its maximum movement (rounded down) to stand up.
Other:
If a Unit gets Crowd Controlled while doing an Ability (e.g. "move, then attack"), what happens depends on the Crowd Control type:
- Pushing, Knock Prone: everything in the Ability that would follow the movement gets cancelled
- Cripple, Daze, Slow: Nothing happens on the spot; the Crowd Control takes effect after the Ability finishes
- Silence: If it's a Spell, the rest of the Spell gets cancelled; otherwise nothing else happens
- Paralyze, Stun, Sleep: The Ability gets cancelled
- Blind: Apply the Harc Cover normally
- Fear: Apply the Cover part of Fear normally, but the movement part happens on the Unit's turn, after the Ability finishes
